description.purpose: The Lightbox modal displays media data such as images or videos. It may also display text that has a purely descriptive nature and does not offer interaction.
description.composition: A Lightbox modal consists of one or multiple lightbox pages representing the text or media together with a title.
description.effect: Lightbox modals are activated by clicking the full view glyphicon, the title of the object or it's thumbnail. If multiple pages are to be displayed, they can flipped through.

usage.1: Lightbox modals MUST contain a title above the presented item.
usage.2: Lightbox modals SHOULD contain a descriptional text below the presented items.
usage.3: Multiple items inside a Lightbox modal MUST be presented in carousel like manner allowing to flickr through items.

description.purpose: A Lightbox image page represents an image inside a Lightbox modal.
description.composition: The page consists of the image, a title and optional description.
description.effect: The image is displayed in the content section of the Lightbox modal and the title is used as modal title. If a description is present, it will be displayed below the image.

usage.2: A Lighbox image page MUST have an image and a short title.
usage.1: A Lightbox image page SHOULD have short a description, describing the presented image. If the description is omitted, the Lightbox image page falls back to the alt tag of the image.

description.purpose: A Lightbox text page represents a document like content/text inside a Lightbox modal.
description.composition: The page consists of text and a title
description.effect: The text is displayed in the content section of the Lightbox modal and the title is used as modal title.

usage.1: A Lighbox text page MUST have text content and a short title.
usage.2: A Lighbox text page MUST NOT have a description.

description.purpose: Standard Popovers are used to display other components. Whenever you want to use the standard-popover, please hand in a PullRequest and discuss it.
description.composition: The content of a Standard Popover displays the components together with an optional title.

usage.1: Standard Popovers MUST NOT be used to render lists, use a Listing Popover for this purpose.
usage.2: Standard Popovers SHOULD NOT contain complex or large components.
usage.3: Usages of Standard Popovers MUST be accepted by JourFixe.
usage.4: Popovers with fixed Position MUST only be attached to triggerers with fixed position.

description.purpose: Listing Popovers are used to display list items.
description.composition: The content of a Listing Popover displays the list together with an optional title.

usage.1: Listing Popovers MUST be used if one needs to display lists inside a Popover.
usage.2: Popovers with fixed Position MUST only be attached to triggerers with fixed position.

description.purpose: File dropzones are used to drop files from outside the browser window. The dropped files are presented to the user and can be uploaded to the server. File dropzones offer additional convenience beside manually selecting files over the file browser.
description.composition: File dropzones are areas to drop the files. They contain either a message (standard file dropzone) or other ILIAS UI components (wrapper file dropzone).
description.effect: A dropzone is highlighted when the user drags files over it.

accessibility.1: There MUST be alternative ways in the system to upload the files due to the limited accessibility of file dropzones.

description.purpose: The standard dropzone is used to drop files dragged from outside the browser window. The dropped files are presented to the user and can be uploaded to the server.
description.composition: Standard dropzones consist of a visible area where files can be dropped. They MUST contain a message explaining that it is possible to drop files inside. The dropped files are presented to the user, optionally with some button to start the upload process.
description.effect: A standard dropzone is highlighted when the user is dragging files over the dropzone. After dropping, the dropped files are presented to the user with some meta information of the files such the file name and file size.

rivals.Rival 1: A wrapper dropzone can hold other ILIAS UI components instead of a message.

usage.1: Standard dropzones MUST contain a message.
usage.2: The upload button MUST be disabled if there are no files to be uploaded. Only true if the dropzone is NOT used in a form containing other form elements.
usage.3: Standard dropzones MAY be used in forms.

accessibility.1: Standard dropzones MUST offer the possibility to select files manually from the computer.

description.purpose: A wrapper dropzone is used to display other ILIAS UI components inside it. In contrast to the standard dropzone, the wrapper dropzone is not visible by default. Only the wrapped components are visible. Any wrapper dropzone gets highlighted once the user is dragging files over the browser window. Thus, a user needs to have the knowledge that there are wrapper dropzones present. They can be introduced to offer additional approaches to complete some workflow more conveniently. Especially in situation where space is scarce such as appointments in the calendar.
description.composition: A wrapper dropzone contains one or multiple ILIAS UI components. A roundtrip modal is used to present the dropped files and to initialize the upload process.
description.effect: All wrapper dropzones on the page are highlighted when the user dragging files over the browser window. After dropping the files, the roundtrip modal is opened showing all files. The modal contains a button to start the upload process.

rivals.Rival 1: A standard dropzone displays a message instead of other ILIAS UI components.

usage.1: Most pages SHOULD NOT contain a wrapper dropzone. Whenever you want to introduce a new usage of the Wrapper-Dropzone, propose it to the Jour Fixe.
usage.2: Wrapper dropzones MUST contain one or more ILIAS UI components.
usage.3: Wrapper dropzones MUST NOT contain any other file dropzones.
usage.4: Wrapper dropzones MUST NOT be used in modals.
usage.5: The upload button in the modal MUST be disabled if there are no files to be uploaded.

description.purpose: The Presentation Table lists some tabular data in a pleasant way. The user can get a quick overview over the records in the dataset, the Presentation Table only shows the most relevant fields of the records at first glance. The records can be expanded to show more extensive information, i.e. additional fields and further information. The Presentation Table represents the displayed dataset an entirety rather than a list of single rows. The table facilitates exploring the dataset, where the purpose of this exploration is known and supported. Single records may be derived and composed from all kind of sources and do not necessarily reference a persistent entity like an ilObject.
description.composition: The Presentation Table consists of a title, a slot for View Controls and Presentation Rows. The rows will be prefixed by an Expand Glyph and consist of a headline, a subheadline and a choice of record-fields. The expanded row will show a lists of further fields and, optionally, a button or dropdown for actions. The table is visually represented as a wholeness and does not decompose into several parts.
description.effect: Rows can be expanded and collapsed to show/hide more extensive and detailed information per record. A click on the Expand Glyph will enlarge the row vertically to show the complete record and exchange the Expand Glyph by a Collapse Glyph. Fields that were shown in the collapsed row will be hidden except for headline and subheadline. The ordering among the records in the table, the ordering of the fields in one row or the visible contents of the table itself can be adjusted with View Controls. In contrast to the accordions known from the page editor, it is possible to have multiple expanded rows in the table.

rivals.1: Data Table: A data-table shows some dataset and offers tools to explore it in a user defined way. Instead of aiming at simplicity the Presentation Table aims at maximum explorability. Datasets that contain long content fields, e.g. free text or images, are hard to fit into a Data Table but can indeed be displayed in a Presentation Table.
rivals.2: Listing Panel: Listing Panels list items, where an item is a unique entity in the system, i.e. an identifyable, persistently stored object. This is not necessarily the case for Presentation Tables, where records can be composed of any data from any source in the system.

usage.1: Rows in the table MUST be of the same structure.

interaction.1: View Controls used here MUST only affect the table itself.
interaction.2: Clicking the Expand Glyph MUST only expand the row. It MUST NOT trigger any other action.

accessibility.1: The expandable content, especially the contained buttons, MUST be accessible by only using the keyboard.

description.purpose: The system failed to complete some actions and displays information about the failure.
description.composition: The alert-danger style is used for the message.

usage.1: The Failure Message Boxes MUST be used, if a user interaction has failed.
usage.2: The message SHOULD inform the user why the interaction has failed.
usage.3: The message SHOULD inform the user how to the problem can be fixed.

description.purpose: The system succeeded in finishing some action and displays a success message.
description.composition: The alert-success style is used for the message.

usage.1: The Success Message Boxes MUST be used, if a user interaction has successfully ended.
usage.2: The message SHOULD summarize how the system state has been changed due to the user interaction.

description.purpose: The system informs the user about obstacles standing in the way of completing a workflow or about side-effects of his or her actions on other users.
description.composition: The alert-info style is used for the message.

usage.1: The Info Message Boxes MAY be used to describe a state or condition of the system that help the user to understand the interactions provided on or missing from a screen.
usage.2: The Info Message Boxes MUST NOT be used at the end of a user interaction. Instead Success or Failure Message Boxes SHOULD be used.

description.purpose: The system makes sure that an action should really be performed.
description.composition: The alert-warning style is used for the message.

usage.1: The Confirmation Message Boxes MUST be used, if a deletion interaction is being processed. The Buttons MUST provide a confirm and a cancel option.
